alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Gloucester; Isle of Wight; James City; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 27 at 3:13PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Gloucester, southeastern Charles City, northwestern Isle of Wight, central Southampton, east central Prince George, northwestern York, Sussex, southern James City, and Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 400 PM EST... At 313 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Purdy to 6 miles southwest of Barley. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Williamsburg, Gloucester Courthouse, Waverly, Wakefield, Claremont, Surry, Queens Lake, College Of William And Mary, Gloucester Point, Sussex, Ivor, Dendron, Busch Gardens, Hayes, Rustic, Carver Gardens, Elberon, Kings Point, Jamestown and Cabin Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Gloucester; Isle of Wight; James City; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex; York
